reference.shortdesc: Data encryption with Secure Socket Layer (SSL) authentication is used with the Couchbase self-signed certificates.

section.title: Syntax
section.p: To retrieve an existing self-signed certificate use the --retrieve-cert option.
To regenerate a self-signed certificate use the --regenerate-cert option.

section.title: Description
section.p: Retrieving an SSL certificate for XDCR data encryption, should be done in a secure manner, such as with ssh and scp. For example:

ol.li: Use a secure method to log in to a node on the destination cluster. For example: ssh.
Retrieve the certificate with the couchbase-cli ssl-manage command.
Use a secure method to transfer the certificate from the destination cluster to the source cluster. For example: scp.
Proceed with setting up XDCR with SSL data encryption.

section.title: Options
section.p: The following are the command options:

row.entry: Retrieves the self-signed certificate from the destination cluster to the source cluster. Specify a local location (full path) and file name for the pem-encoded certificate. For example, --retrieve-cert=./newCert.pem.
Regenerates a self-signed certificate on the destination cluster. Specify the full path for the location of the pem-encoded certificate file. For example, --regenerate-cert=./newRegen.pem.
